name: Commonwealth, Appellant, v. National Tube Works Company
name_abbreviation: Commonwealth v. National Tube Works Co.

judges: Before Mitchell, Dean, Fell, Brown and Potter, JJ.
parties: Commonwealth, Appellant, v. National Tube Works Company.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
Judgment affirmed on opinion of the court below in Com. v. American Car and Foundry Company, ante, p. 302.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Frederic W. Fleitz, deputy attorney general, and John P. Ellcin, attorney general, for appellant.
M. E. Olmsted, with him A. O. Stamm, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth, Appellant, v. National Tube Works Company.
Argued June 3, 1902.
Appeal, No. 1, May T., 1903, by plaintiff, from judgment of C. P. Commonwealth Docket, 1900, No. 13, for defendant, on appeal from tax settlement in case of Commonwealth y. National Tube Works Company.
Before Mitchell, Dean, Fell, Brown and Potter, JJ.
Affirmed.
Frederic W. Fleitz, deputy attorney general, and John P. Ellcin, attorney general, for appellant.
M. E. Olmsted, with him A. O. Stamm, for appellee.
June 3, 1902:
